children.text:
subroutine bubble_sort(arr, n)

   integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

   integer, intent(in) :: n

   integer :: i, j, temp do i =1, n-1

      do j =1, n-i

          if (arr(j) > arr(j+1)) then

              temp = arr(j)

              arr(j) = arr(j+1)

              arr(j+1) = temp

          end if

      end do

   end do

end subroutine bubble_sort

Then, in the main program: call bubble_sort(a, n)

program main

   implicit none

   integer :: n, k, sum1, count, MOD = 1000000007

   integer, allocatable :: a(:)

   character(len=20) :: s

   character(len=20) :: input_str

   ! First part: read n, k, array, compute sum1

   read *, n, k

   allocate(a(n))

   read *, a

   call bubble_sort(a, n)  ! Sort in ascending order

   sum1 = sum(a(1:k))

   ! Second part: process sum1 as a string to get count

   write(s, '(i0)') sum1

   s = adjustl(s)

   count = process_second(s)

   ! Third part: process count as a string to get final result

   write(input_str, '(i0)') count

   input_str = adjustl(input_str)

   integer :: result = process_third(input_str)

   print *, result

contains

   subroutine bubble_sort(arr, n)

      integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

      integer, intent(in) :: n

      integer :: i, j, temp do i =1, n-1

         do j =1, n-i

             if (arr(j) > arr(j+1)) then

                 temp = arr(j)

                 arr(j) = arr(j+1)

                 arr(j+1) = temp

             end if

         end do

      end do

   end subroutine bubble_sort

   function process_second(s) result(count)

      character(len=*), intent(in) :: s

      integer :: count, a1, a2, len, i

      character(len=len_trim(s)) :: a_str, b_str

      a_str = s

      b_str = s

      a1 =0

      a2 =0

      len = len_trim(s)

      ! Process a_str: left to right

      do i=2, len

         if (a_str(i:i) == a_str(i-1:i-1)) then

             if (a_str(i:i) == '1') then

                 a_str(i:i) = '0'

             else

                 a_str(i: i) = '1'

             end if

             a1 = a1 +1

         end if

      end do

      ! Process b_str: right to left do i = len, 2, -1

         if (b_str(i:i) == b_str(i-1:i-1)) then

             if (b_str(i-1:i-1) == '1') then

                 b_str(i-1:i-1) = '0'

             else

                 b_str(i-1:i-1) = '1'

             end if

             a2 = a2 +1

         end if

      end do

      count = min(a1, a2)

   end function process_second

   function process_third(input_str) result(final_result)

      character(len=*), intent(in) :: input_str

      integer :: final_result, MOD = 1000000007

      integer :: len, i, d, pre, new_mod, base, j

      character(len=1), dimension(:), allocatable :: chars_reversed

      integer, dimension(0:12) :: dp_prev, curr_dp

      len = len_trim(input_str)

      allocate(chars_reversed(len))

      ! Reverse the string to process from end to start

      do i =1, len

          chars_reversed(i) = input_str(len -i

   end function process_third

end program main

program main

   implicit none

   integer :: n, k, sum1, count, MOD = 1000000007

   integer, allocatable :: a(:)

   character(len=20) :: s

   character(len=20) :: input_str

   ! First part: read n, k, array, compute sum1

   read *, n, k

   allocate(a(n))

   read *, a

   call sort(a)  ! Assuming a is sorted in ascending order

   sum1 = sum(a(1:k))

   ! Second part: process sum1 as a string to get count

   write(s, '(i0)') sum1

   s = adjustl(s)

   count = process_second(s)

   ! Third part: process count as a string to get final result

   write(input_str, '(i0)') count

   input_str = adjustl(input_str)

   integer :: result = process_third(input_str)

   print *, result

contains

   function process_second(s) result(count)

      character(len=*), intent(in) :: s

      integer :: count, a1, a2, len, i

      character(len=len_trim(s)) :: a_str, b_str

      a_str = s

      b_str = s

      a1 =0

      a2 =0

      len = len_trim(s)

      ! Process a_str: left to right

      do i=2, len

         if (a_str(i:i) == a_str(i-1:i-1)) then

             if (a_str(i:i) == '1') then

                 a_str(i:i) = '0'

             else

                 a_str(i:i) = '1'

             end if

             a1 = a1 +1

         end if

      end do

      ! Process b_str: right to left

      do i = len, 2, -1

         if (b_str(i:i) == b_str(i-1:i-1)) then

             if (b_str(i-1:i-1) == '1') then

                 b_str(i-1:i-1) = '0'

             else

                 b_str(i-1:i-1) = '1'

             end if

             a2 = a2 +1

         end if

      end do

      count = min(a1, a2)

   end function process_second

   function process_third(input_str) result(final_result)

      character(len=*), intent(in) :: input_str

      integer :: final_result, MOD = 1000000007

      integer :: len, i, d, pre, new_mod, base

      character(len=1), dimension(:), allocatable :: chars_reversed

      integer, dimension(0:12) :: dp_prev, curr_dp

      len = len_trim(input_str)

      allocate(chars_reversed(len))

      ! Reverse the string to process from end to start

      do i =1, len

          chars_reversed(i) = input_str(len -i +1: len -i +1)

      end do

      ! Initialize DP

      dp_prev = 0

      dp_prev(0) =1

      do i =1, len

          ! Current character is chars_reversed(i)

          character(len=1) :: current_char = chars_reversed(i)

          ! Compute base: 10^(i-1) mod13

          base = 1

          do j=1, i-1

              base = mod(base *10, 13)

          end do

          ! Initialize curr_dp to 0

          curr_dp = 0

          if (current_char == '?') then

              do d=0,9

                  do pre=0,12

                      if (dp_prev(pre) ==0) cycle

                      new_mod = mod(d * base + pre,13)

                      curr_dp(new_mod) = mod(curr_dp(new_mod) + dp_prev(pre), MOD)

                  end do

              end do

          else

              read(current_char, '(i1)') d

              do pre=0,12

                  if (dp_prev(pre) ==0) cycle

                  new_mod = mod(d * base + pre,13)

                  curr_dp(new_mod) = mod(curr_dp(new_mod) + dp_prev(pre), MOD)

              end do

          end if

          dp_prev = curr_dp

      end do

      final_result = mod(dp_prev(5), MOD)

   end function process_third

end program main

subroutine bubble_sort(arr, n)

   integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

   integer, intent(in) :: n

   integer :: i, j, temp

   do i =1, n-1

      do j =1, n-i

          if (arr(j) > arr(j+1)) then

              temp = arr(j)

              arr(j) = arr(j+1)

              arr(j+1) = temp

          end if

      end do

   end do

end subroutine bubble_sort

   sum1 = sum(a(1:k))

   ! Second part: process sum1 as a string to get count

   write(s, '(i0)') sum1

   s = adjustl(s)

   count = process_second(s)

   ! Third part: process count as a string to get final result

   write(input_str, '(i0)') count

   input_str = adjustl(input_str)

   integer :: result = process_third(input_str)

   print *, result

contains

   subroutine bubble_sort(arr, n)

      integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

      integer, intent(in) :: n

      integer :: i, j, temp

      do i =1, n-1

         do j =1, n-i

             if (arr(j) > arr(j+1)) then

                 temp = arr(j)

                 arr(j) = arr(j+1)

                 arr(j+1) = temp

             end if

         end do

      end do

   end subroutine bubble_sort

   function process_second(s) result(count)

      character(len=*), intent(in) :: s

      integer :: count, a1, a2, len, i

      character(len=len_trim(s)) :: a_str, b_str

      a_str = s

      b_str = s

      a1 =0

      a2 =0

      len = len_trim(s)

      ! Process a_str: left to right

      do i=2, len

         if (a_str(i:i) == a_str(i-1:i-1)) then

             if (a_str(i:i) == '1') then

                 a_str(i:i) = '0'

             else

                 a_str(i:i) = '1'

             end if

             a1 = a1 +1

         end if

      end do

      ! Process b_str: right to left

      do i = len, 2, -1

         if (b_str(i:i) == b_str(i-1:i-1)) then

             if (b_str(i-1:i-1) == '1') then

                 b_str(i-1:i-1) = '0'

             else

                 b_str(i-1:i-1) = '1'

             end if

             a2 = a2 +1

         end if

      end do

      count = min(a1, a2)

   end function process_second

   function process_third(input_str) result(final_result)

      character(len=*), intent(in) :: input_str

      integer :: final_result, MOD = 1000000007

      integer :: len, i, d, pre, new_mod, base, j

      character(len=1), dimension(:), allocatable :: chars_reversed

      integer, dimension(0:12) :: dp_prev, curr_dp

      len = len_trim(input_str)

      allocate(chars_reversed(len))

      ! Reverse the string to process from end to start

      do i =1, len

          chars_reversed(i) = input_str(len -i +1: len -i +1)

      end do

      ! Initialize DP

      dp_prev = 0

      dp_prev(0) =1

      do i =1, len

          ! Current character is chars_reversed(i)

          character(len=1) :: current_char = chars_reversed(i)

          ! Compute base: 10^(i-1) mod13

          base =1

          do j=1, i-1

              base = mod(base *10,13)

          end do

          ! Initialize curr_dp to 0

          curr_dp = 0

          if (current_char == '?') then

              do d=0,9

                  do pre=0,12

                      if (dp_prev(pre) ==0) cycle

                      new_mod = mod(d * base + pre,13)

                      curr_dp(new_mod) = mod(curr_dp(new_mod) + dp_prev(pre), MOD)

                  end do

              end do

          else

              read(current_char, '(i1)') d

              do pre=0,12

                  if (dp_prev(pre) ==0) cycle

                  new_mod = mod(d * base + pre,13)

                  curr_dp(new_mod) = mod(curr_dp(new_mod) + dp_prev(pre), MOD)

              end do

          end if

          dp_prev = curr_dp

      end do

      final_result = mod(dp_prev(5), MOD)

   end function process_third
